data:
1
00:00:44,263 --> 00:00:47,583
People once believed
that when someone dies...

2
00:00:47,583 --> 00:00:50,703
a crow carries their soul
to the land of the dead.

3
00:00:51,523 --> 00:00:54,473
But sometimes,
something so bad happens...

4
00:00:54,903 --> 00:00:58,703
that a terrible sadness is carried
with it and the soul can't rest.

5
00:01:00,223 --> 00:01:02,663
Then sometimes,
just sometimes...

6
00:01:03,223 --> 00:01:07,303
the crow can bring that soul back
to put the wrong things right.

7
00:01:49,383 --> 00:01:51,183
Over here.

8
00:01:55,743 --> 00:01:57,263
Hey, Sarge!

9
00:01:57,823 --> 00:01:59,103
Yeah?

10
00:02:00,023 --> 00:02:03,903
Shelly Webster and Eric Draven.
Wedding was tomorrow night.

11
00:02:04,423 --> 00:02:07,383
Who the fuck gets married
on Halloween anyhow?

12
00:02:08,663 --> 00:02:10,023
Nobody.

13
00:02:11,983 --> 00:02:14,653
- Sir, we gotta move her.
- Do it.

14
00:02:14,903 --> 00:02:17,143
All right, guys,
let's do it.

15
00:02:17,143 --> 00:02:20,143
Devil's fuckin' Night.
What's the count so far?

16
00:02:20,303 --> 00:02:21,663
143 fires.

17
00:02:21,663 --> 00:02:24,423
- They're slacking off from last year.
- Three hours to go.

18
00:02:24,423 --> 00:02:27,663
- Maybe they're just slow starters.
- Coming through!

19
00:02:31,943 --> 00:02:35,223
You guys can't come in here
and take her away like this.

20
00:02:35,223 --> 00:02:38,943
There are procedures. You should have
cleared this with me first

21
00:02:39,903 --> 00:02:42,143
- Is this the victim?
- No, it's Amelia Earhart.

22
00:02:42,143 --> 00:02:44,983
- We found her, and you missed it.
- I don't care what her name is.

23
00:02:44,983 --> 00:02:47,833
I didn't give the order to move her.
Jesus, Albrecht.

24
00:02:48,083 --> 00:02:50,733
I can see why they took away
your gold shield.

25
00:02:50,983 --> 00:02:53,903
Yeah, I wasn't a big enough asshole.
Come on. Let's go.

26
00:02:53,903 --> 00:02:56,463
- All right, clear out.

27
00:02:57,063 --> 00:02:59,303
- Shelly?
- Stand back, kid.

28
00:03:01,703 --> 00:03:04,623
- Where's Eric?
- Just don't worry about him.

29
00:03:06,123 --> 00:03:08,273
Tell him to take care
of Sarah.

30
00:03:08,523 --> 00:03:12,523
Look, I will.
You just, uh, lie back. Come on.

31
00:03:21,343 --> 00:03:23,263
- You Sarah?
- Yeah.

32
00:03:24,223 --> 00:03:27,143
Yeah, look. Your sister,
she's gonna be okay.

33
00:03:28,143 --> 00:03:31,263
She's not my sister.
Shelly just takes care of me.

34
00:03:31,343 --> 00:03:33,343
She's my friend.

35
00:03:33,663 --> 00:03:35,263
Her and Eric.

36
00:03:37,463 --> 00:03:39,623
You lied to her about Eric.

37
00:03:39,663 --> 00:03:41,103
I had to.

38
00:03:41,623 --> 00:03:44,183
And you're lying
to me about Shelly.

39
00:03:44,903 --> 00:03:47,103
She's gonna die,
isn't she?

40
00:03:49,923 --> 00:03:51,363
Hey, uh--

41
00:03:56,983 --> 00:04:00,023
Now, come on.
Come on. It's okay.

42
00:04:02,863 --> 00:04:04,743
She's gonna be fine.

43
00:04:22,863 --> 00:04:26,493
A building gets torched.
All that is left is ashes.

44
00:04:26,743 --> 00:04:29,623
I used to think that was true
about everything...

45
00:04:29,623 --> 00:04:33,023
families, friends, feelings.

46
00:04:33,903 --> 00:04:37,493
But now I know that sometimes,
if love proves real...

47
00:04:37,743 --> 00:04:41,923
two people who are meant to be together,
nothing can keep them apart.

48
00:05:08,303 --> 00:05:09,623
Later.

49
00:05:18,583 --> 00:05:21,223
What are you,
like the night watchman?

50
00:05:42,143 --> 00:05:44,813
You know, what this place
needs is a...

51
00:05:45,063 --> 00:05:47,533
good natural catastrophe.

52
00:05:47,783 --> 00:05:51,813
- Earthquake, tornado, you know.
- No, no, no, no.

53
00:05:52,063 --> 00:05:54,983
Mickey, come on, man. You got to put
the mustard underneath first.

54
00:05:54,983 --> 00:05:57,263
Maybe a flood like in the Bible.

55
00:05:57,263 --> 00:05:59,263
Hey, hey, let me do it.

56
00:06:00,303 --> 00:06:03,933
There we go. All right.
How about some onions?

57
00:06:04,183 --> 00:06:06,623
Come on, man.
Don't cheap out on me.

58
00:06:06,623 --> 00:06:08,543
- Lots of onions.
- All right, here you go.

59
00:06:08,543 --> 00:06:10,223
Hey, all right.

60
00:06:10,863 --> 00:06:12,663
Now we're talkin'.

61
00:06:13,303 --> 00:06:16,353
Hey, it's the Sarah monster.

62
00:06:17,863 --> 00:06:21,343
- How do you steer that on a wet street?
- Pure talent. Hi.

63
00:06:21,583 --> 00:06:25,173
Now, Sarah, she's a genuine hot dogger.
You hungry?

64
00:06:25,423 --> 00:06:27,223
- You buyin'?
- I'm buyin'.

65
00:06:27,223 --> 00:06:30,513
- No onions though, okay?
- No onions?

66
00:06:30,863 --> 00:06:33,823
They make you fart big time.

67
00:06:40,023 --> 00:06:42,703
You know, Lake Erie
actually caught on fire once...

68
00:06:42,703 --> 00:06:45,423
from all the crap
floating around in it.

69
00:06:46,383 --> 00:06:49,263
I wish I could have seen that.

70
00:07:47,783 --> 00:07:50,263
Fire it up! Yeah!

71
00:08:29,623 --> 00:08:33,133
- All right, we busted their machines!
- Shit!

72
00:08:55,343 --> 00:08:58,713
Oh, oh, shit, guys.
T-bird, cop car, cop car.

73
00:09:05,583 --> 00:09:08,183
Bad people out
on the street tonight.

74
00:09:13,863 --> 00:09:15,783
- Damn it!
- What was that?

75
00:09:15,783 --> 00:09:18,343
- You wait right here.
- Be careful.

76
00:09:18,383 --> 00:09:21,463
Mickey, call it in for me!

77
00:10:39,863 --> 00:10:41,943
Gabriel.

78
00:10:51,623 --> 00:10:54,703
- Eric?
- Department of Housing!

79
00:10:54,963 --> 00:10:58,213
Code violations?
Safety hazards?

80
00:10:59,063 --> 00:11:01,063
Place looks fine to me.

81
00:11:01,263 --> 00:11:03,023
Let's redecorate.

82
00:11:06,923 --> 00:11:09,773
"Abash, the devil stood...

83
00:11:10,023 --> 00:11:12,383
and felt how awful goodness is.

84
00:11:13,063 --> 00:11:17,673
Saw virtue in her shape, how lovely."
It's pornography.

85
00:11:18,543 --> 00:11:20,543
Virtue?

86
00:11:23,443 --> 00:11:25,443
Shelly?

87
00:11:27,063 --> 00:11:29,783
- No! Eric!
- See ya!

88
00:11:30,063 --> 00:11:31,983
No, no, no, me first.

89
00:11:34,703 --> 00:11:36,063
Please.

90
00:11:38,383 --> 00:11:40,183
- Shelly.
- Eric!

91
00:12:18,543 --> 00:12:21,343
- Hey, that's good.
- That's good.

92
00:12:25,063 --> 00:12:28,063
See if you can top that, man.
Can you top that?

93
00:12:28,583 --> 00:12:30,783
Look at that.
Look at that.

94
00:12:31,743 --> 00:12:35,373
Here's to Devil's Night,
my new favorite holiday.

95
00:12:39,463 --> 00:12:41,503
You go over there
and talk to your pals--

96
00:12:42,403 --> 00:12:44,713
You sick fuck.

97
00:12:44,503 --> 00:12:48,083
Are you out of
your motherfuckin' mind, man?

98
00:12:53,543 --> 00:12:55,143
Look at that!

99
00:12:56,903 --> 00:12:58,943
Pussies drink last, man.

100
00:13:00,063 --> 00:13:02,713
- Fuck you, Tin Tin.
- Hey.

101
00:13:04,303 --> 00:13:06,543
Shit ain't even loaded, man.

102
00:13:06,863 --> 00:13:08,423
This one is.

103
00:13:08,943 --> 00:13:11,573
Which of you Motor City
motherfuckers...

104
00:13:11,823 --> 00:13:14,183
wants to bet me this one isn't?

105
00:13:16,063 --> 00:13:19,613
Hey, fire it up!
Fire it up!

106
00:13:19,863 --> 00:13:22,663
- Fire it up!
- Fire it up!
- Fire it up!

107
00:13:22,903 --> 00:13:25,403
Fire it up! Fire it up!

108
00:13:26,663 --> 00:13:28,413
Here's your shooters.

109
00:13:28,663 --> 00:13:30,703
- Put your guns away, huh, guys?
- How ya doin'?

110
00:13:30,703 --> 00:13:32,143
Pussycat.

111
00:13:53,963 --> 00:13:55,923
Boo.

112
00:14:04,503 --> 00:14:07,693
- I love you.
- Say that again.

113
00:14:07,943 --> 00:14:09,463
I love you.

114
00:14:10,223 --> 00:14:12,343
Oh, boy.

115
00:14:13,303 --> 00:14:15,383
Restaurant.

116
00:14:21,063 --> 00:14:24,263
- Wow, you look great.
- Ta-da!

117
00:14:27,143 --> 00:14:29,143
Yeah!

118
00:14:30,903 --> 00:14:33,583
- Come here!
- No, no, no!

119
00:16:07,503 --> 00:16:09,823
Couple more rings.
That's 24k.

120
00:16:09,983 --> 00:16:13,613
24k, huh? It's 18k.
It's crap. It's probably fake.

121
00:16:13,863 --> 00:16:15,863
Leather purse. Leather.

122
00:16:16,783 --> 00:16:20,333
Geez. Oh, what is this, Tin Tin?

123
00:16:20,583 --> 00:16:22,863
A blood stain that's on here?

124
00:16:25,063 --> 00:16:27,663
I'll give you 50 bucks.
And I hate charities.

125
00:16:27,663 --> 00:16:29,983
Now, you,
take it or leave it.

126
00:16:30,723 --> 00:16:32,563
Right there for ya.

127
00:16:34,443 --> 00:16:36,363
Decisions, decisions.

128
00:16:38,823 --> 00:16:41,943
You cheap ass, chrome dome...

129
00:16:41,943 --> 00:16:44,693
...child molestin',
saprophyte motherfucker.

130
00:16:44,943 --> 00:16:46,513
Close the gate
when you go out!

131
00:16:46,763 --> 00:16:49,653
Oh, I close this up
for you real good, massa.

132
00:16:49,903 --> 00:16:52,063
Fuck you.

133
00:16:53,083 --> 00:16:55,883
Yeah, sit on it and twirl,
you dirty scum.

134
00:17:00,183 --> 00:17:02,623
Lucky I didn't stab
your fat ass.

135
00:18:44,743 --> 00:18:47,983
What the fuck you all painted
up for, crackhead, huh?

136
00:18:51,903 --> 00:18:54,453
Halloween ain't till manana.

137
00:18:57,983 --> 00:18:59,383
Come on.

138
00:19:35,023 --> 00:19:37,713
Fuck, you murderer!

139
00:19:38,343 --> 00:19:40,943
I ain't murdered nobody, man!
I don't even fucking know you!

140
00:19:40,943 --> 00:19:44,783
- Man, what the fuck you want, man?
- I want you to tell me a story.

141
00:19:44,943 --> 00:19:47,623
A man and a woman
in a loft a year ago.

142
00:19:48,343 --> 00:19:50,823
- You're out of your fucking mind--
- Listen!

143
00:19:50,823 --> 00:19:55,333
I'm sure you'll remember.
You killed them... on Halloween.

144
00:19:55,583 --> 00:19:59,943
Yeah, yeah, Halloween, yeah.
Some dude, some bitch, whatever, man.

145
00:20:00,383 --> 00:20:02,783
Her name was Shelly.

146
00:20:02,783 --> 00:20:04,983
You cut her.
You raped her.

147
00:20:05,783 --> 00:20:10,703
Shelly, yeah, yeah. I shanked
her pink ass and she loved it!

148
00:20:20,183 --> 00:20:24,733
Murderer? Murderer? Let me tell you
about murder. It's fun!

149
00:20:24,983 --> 00:20:29,403
It's easy.
You gonna learn all about it.

150
00:20:33,903 --> 00:20:36,813
I'd like you to meet
two buddies of mine.

151
00:20:37,663 --> 00:20:39,303
We never miss.

152
00:20:48,063 --> 00:20:49,153
Try harder.

153
00:20:49,403 --> 00:20:51,323
- Try again!
- Aaah!

154
00:20:57,183 --> 00:21:00,723
Victims.
Aren't we all?

155
00:21:24,383 --> 00:21:28,713
- Look at this mess!
What's the world comin' to?
- It's a mess.

156
00:21:35,623 --> 00:21:38,343
I got to go upstairs.
Report from the front.

157
00:21:42,783 --> 00:21:45,063
Get out of my way,
you worms!

158
00:21:47,023 --> 00:21:49,423
Give me some of that
over there!

159
00:21:51,063 --> 00:21:54,163
Why don't you ladies come by later?
Check me out.

160
00:21:54,663 --> 00:21:59,093
Hey, guess what?
Arcade Games fell down, went boom.

161
00:21:59,343 --> 00:22:02,773
- Boom.
- Can you imagine that? It's tragic.

162
00:22:03,023 --> 00:22:07,393
Gather your soldiers.
You're on for tomorrow night. No sweat.

163
00:22:07,643 --> 00:22:10,453
- Is the man in?
- He's taking a meeting.

164
00:22:39,823 --> 00:22:42,183
You're thinking
about the past.

165
00:22:45,703 --> 00:22:47,463
Dad gave me this.

166
00:22:48,183 --> 00:22:49,863
Fifth birthday.

167
00:22:52,263 --> 00:22:56,213
He said childhood's over
the moment you know you're gonna die.

168
00:23:09,663 --> 00:23:11,453
Is she asleep?

169
00:23:18,343 --> 00:23:20,263
I think we broke her.

170
00:23:25,343 --> 00:23:27,063
I love her eyes.

171
00:23:27,383 --> 00:23:28,743
Pretty.

172
00:24:08,763 --> 00:24:11,173
I told you to stay out of here.

173
00:24:11,423 --> 00:24:15,023
So I guess you're not gonna be home
till a lot later, huh, Darla?

174
00:24:15,023 --> 00:24:18,733
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

175
00:24:18,983 --> 00:24:20,983
I don't have any dolls.

176
00:24:23,303 --> 00:24:25,143
Get some food, huh?

177
00:24:24,583 --> 00:24:27,543
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

178
00:24:32,863 --> 00:24:36,703
"Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police."

179
00:24:46,023 --> 00:24:47,983
Thirty, forty dollars.

180
00:24:50,823 --> 00:24:52,903
Who the fuck is this now?

181
00:24:53,263 --> 00:24:57,013
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

182
00:24:57,263 --> 00:24:59,383
Cerrado!

183
00:24:59,943 --> 00:25:03,943
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

184
00:25:10,903 --> 00:25:14,433
Goddamn creatures of the night,
they never learn.

185
00:25:16,663 --> 00:25:18,103
Hey! Hey!

186
00:25:22,343 --> 00:25:26,333
"Suddenly I heard
a tapping, as if someone...

187
00:25:26,583 --> 00:25:29,853
gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door."

188
00:25:32,223 --> 00:25:34,383
What are you talking about?

189
00:25:34,543 --> 00:25:36,743
You heard me rapping, right?

190
00:25:37,183 --> 00:25:40,913
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fuckin' new door!

191
00:25:43,463 --> 00:25:46,383
I'm looking for something
in an engagement ring.

192
00:25:46,383 --> 00:25:47,663
Gold.

193
00:25:47,823 --> 00:25:50,783
You're looking for a coroner,
shit-for-brains.

194
00:25:54,143 --> 00:25:56,263
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

195
00:25:59,103 --> 00:26:01,143
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

196
00:26:07,463 --> 00:26:09,423
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

197
00:26:09,663 --> 00:26:11,863
You're not paying attention.

198
00:26:15,323 --> 00:26:16,833
No!

199
00:26:17,783 --> 00:26:21,973
I repeat, a gold
engagement ring, yes?

200
00:26:23,463 --> 00:26:27,263
It was pawned here a year ago
by a customer of yours named Tin Tin.

201
00:26:29,683 --> 00:26:32,893
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

202
00:26:37,943 --> 00:26:39,983
Who's this sack of shit?

203
00:26:39,983 --> 00:26:42,863
That's Tin Tin, one of
T-bird's little helpers.

204
00:26:42,863 --> 00:26:45,663
I think you can rule out
accidental death.

205
00:26:45,863 --> 00:26:48,623
Don't any of your street demons
have real grown-up names?

206
00:26:48,623 --> 00:26:52,623
This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't
look like your usual gang crap.

207
00:26:52,703 --> 00:26:57,013
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

208
00:26:57,263 --> 00:26:59,183
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

209
00:26:59,183 --> 00:27:02,873
Word to the wise:
Watch your fuckin' mouth.

210
00:27:03,983 --> 00:27:06,343
What the hell
do you call that?

211
00:27:08,303 --> 00:27:10,463
I call it blood, detective.

212
00:27:09,863 --> 00:27:13,223
I suppose you'll write it up
as graffiti.

213
00:27:13,583 --> 00:27:16,263
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

214
00:27:23,663 --> 00:27:24,753
- Warmer?
- What are you doing?

215
00:27:25,003 --> 00:27:27,853
- Don't you know this game?
- What game are you talkin' about?

216
00:27:28,103 --> 00:27:30,983
Okay, the rings!
I'll tell you about the rings!

217
00:27:30,983 --> 00:27:34,263
They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

218
00:27:35,263 --> 00:27:40,803
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

219
00:27:44,023 --> 00:27:46,623
- Look, it goes to the attic.
- Okay.

220
00:27:55,263 --> 00:27:56,973
No, no.

221
00:27:57,303 --> 00:27:59,673
No, no, no.

222
00:28:02,663 --> 00:28:06,043
Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

223
00:28:10,463 --> 00:28:11,823
Shelly.

224
00:28:20,543 --> 00:28:22,063
I love you.

225
00:28:29,583 --> 00:28:32,463
- You have one chance to live.
- Take anything you want.

226
00:28:32,463 --> 00:28:34,743
- Thank you.
- Take anything!

227
00:28:36,603 --> 00:28:38,693
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

228
00:28:38,943 --> 00:28:40,393
the rest of Tin Tin's
little party pals.

229
00:28:40,643 --> 00:28:42,963
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

230
00:28:43,263 --> 00:28:47,343
T-birds's little potato-heads hang out
there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

231
00:28:48,223 --> 00:28:51,273
- Funboy.
- Oh, baby, oh.

232
00:28:51,923 --> 00:28:54,363
- A whole jolly club...
- Please!

233
00:28:54,903 --> 00:28:57,583
- with jolly pirate nicknames!
- Stop! Please!

234
00:28:57,583 --> 00:29:00,383
- Jesus Christ in a taxicab!
- Hold still!

235
00:29:01,783 --> 00:29:04,413
Each one of these is a life...

236
00:29:05,103 --> 00:29:07,223
a life you helped destroy.

237
00:29:07,943 --> 00:29:10,303
I'm begging you.
Don't kill me.

238
00:29:11,143 --> 00:29:13,143
I'm not gonna kill you.

239
00:29:13,743 --> 00:29:17,823
Your job will be to tell the rest
of them that death is coming for them...

240
00:29:17,823 --> 00:29:19,223
tonight.

241
00:29:26,063 --> 00:29:29,183
Tell them Eric Draven
sends his regards.

242
00:29:31,863 --> 00:29:35,223
You walk outta here,
they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

243
00:29:35,823 --> 00:29:39,133
You're nothing but street grease,
you motherfucker!

244
00:29:39,383 --> 00:29:41,463
Is that gasoline I smell?

245
00:29:41,583 --> 00:29:43,343
No, man, no!
No!

246
00:29:44,463 --> 00:29:45,663
No!

247
00:29:46,503 --> 00:29:47,703
No!

248
00:30:02,823 --> 00:30:05,543
It's on the house, kiddo,
you know that.

249
00:30:06,223 --> 00:30:07,863
One root beer.

250
00:30:10,343 --> 00:30:12,783
I can't do anything.

251
00:30:12,983 --> 00:30:16,653
Your mom... technically,
she's off right now.

252
00:30:17,383 --> 00:30:19,023
Yeah, way off.

253
00:30:23,823 --> 00:30:27,663
Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

254
00:30:28,623 --> 00:30:31,543
I thought the police
always said, "Freeze!"

255
00:30:31,543 --> 00:30:35,383
I am the police and I say don't move,
Snow White. You move, you're dead.

256
00:30:35,883 --> 00:30:39,713
And I say I'm dead
and I move.

257
00:30:40,723 --> 00:30:43,453
Not one more step.
I'm serious.

258
00:30:43,703 --> 00:30:47,693
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

259
00:30:47,943 --> 00:30:50,623
What are you, nuts?
Walking into a gun?

260
00:30:51,683 --> 00:30:52,493
You high?

261
00:30:52,943 --> 00:30:55,573
- You don't remember me?
- What are you talking about?

262
00:30:55,923 --> 00:30:59,493
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

263
00:30:59,743 --> 00:31:02,143
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

264
00:31:02,383 --> 00:31:06,453
I want you to move over to the curb,
nice and easy. Come on! Move it!

265
00:31:08,903 --> 00:31:11,593
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

266
00:31:11,843 --> 00:31:15,693
- It's gettin' too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

267
00:31:15,943 --> 00:31:18,303
Do you know someone named T-bird?

268
00:31:18,303 --> 00:31:22,533
He had a friend who shouldn't have
played with knives. Like the coat?

269
00:31:22,783 --> 00:31:25,383
You're the guy
that murdered Tin Tin.

270
00:31:25,383 --> 00:31:28,463
He was already dead.

271
00:31:28,823 --> 00:31:32,823
He died a year ago.
The moment he touched her.

272
00:31:34,123 --> 00:31:37,283
They're all dead.
They just don't know it yet.

273
00:31:37,923 --> 00:31:39,803
Get away from there!

274
00:31:39,983 --> 00:31:41,943
Cops!
Get outta here!

275
00:31:43,063 --> 00:31:46,103
Leave it, leave it!
Run!

276
00:31:51,463 --> 00:31:54,143
Oh, great, great.

277
00:31:55,703 --> 00:31:58,223
Guy shows up looking like
a mime from hell...

278
00:31:58,223 --> 00:32:00,543
and you lose him
right out in the open.

279
00:32:00,543 --> 00:32:05,853
Well, at least he didn't do that walking
against the wind shit. I hate that.

280
00:32:06,263 --> 00:32:08,623
Little early for Devil's Night.

281
00:32:11,503 --> 00:32:13,463
You are very restless.

282
00:32:14,223 --> 00:32:17,343
Just wish I was a little
hungry again, that's all.

283
00:32:17,383 --> 00:32:21,023
- Be careful of what you ask for.
- Yeah, I may get it, I know.

284
00:32:32,463 --> 00:32:35,183
There are energies
aligning against you.

285
00:32:35,383 --> 00:32:37,703
Seeing is believing, isn't it?

286
00:32:48,143 --> 00:32:49,663
Mmm, yummy.

287
00:32:56,183 --> 00:32:59,423
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down
to the foundation.

288
00:33:00,023 --> 00:33:02,433
Nobody cleared this
little event with me.

289
00:33:02,683 --> 00:33:03,933
I didn't have nothing
to do with that.

290
00:33:04,583 --> 00:33:06,733
You must be awfully disappointed.

291
00:33:06,983 --> 00:33:10,143
I got trouble.
One of my crew got himself perished.

292
00:33:10,863 --> 00:33:13,103
- Yeah, who might that be?
- Tin Tin.

293
00:33:13,103 --> 00:33:17,103
Somebody stuck his blades in all his
major organs in alphabetical order.

294
00:33:17,583 --> 00:33:20,063
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

295
00:33:20,063 --> 00:33:23,463
an introspective moment of silence
for poor, old Tin Tin.

296
00:33:25,703 --> 00:33:28,263
You're working for me
tomorrow night, right?

297
00:33:28,263 --> 00:33:30,863
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

298
00:33:31,023 --> 00:33:33,023
That's very reassuring.

299
00:33:33,783 --> 00:33:36,703
I still ain't heard
why Gideon's burned down.

300
00:33:37,663 --> 00:33:41,563
Is that a natural catastrophe
or act of God or something?

301
00:33:42,023 --> 00:33:44,263
Call it my need to know.

302
00:34:16,023 --> 00:34:17,823
Let go, you creep!

303
00:34:21,703 --> 00:34:23,463
Nah.

304
00:34:23,463 --> 00:34:26,183
You didn't even slow down,
you dickhead!

305
00:34:27,983 --> 00:34:30,063
He couldn't have stopped.

306
00:34:30,343 --> 00:34:33,063
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

307
00:34:34,543 --> 00:34:37,583
What are you supposed to be,
a clown or something?

308
00:34:37,583 --> 00:34:39,063
Sometimes.

309
00:34:41,423 --> 00:34:45,543
It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

310
00:34:47,143 --> 00:34:49,743
- It can't rain all the time.
- Eric?

311
00:35:06,743 --> 00:35:10,933
Don't thank me.
Are we fighting the good fight?

312
00:35:11,183 --> 00:35:14,673
Double homicide a year ago.
No convictions.

313
00:35:15,423 --> 00:35:17,733
Annie...
Look at that.

314
00:35:18,823 --> 00:35:23,293
"We, the undersigned tenants of
1929 Caulderon Court Apartments--"

315
00:35:23,543 --> 00:35:25,033
What is this, a petition?

316
00:35:24,983 --> 00:35:27,533
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

317
00:35:27,783 --> 00:35:31,743
- The cause got her killed.
- She was fighting tenant eviction
in that neighborhood?

318
00:35:31,743 --> 00:35:36,013
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

319
00:35:37,503 --> 00:35:40,983
The last time you snooped around a case
is when you got put back on the beat.

320
00:35:40,983 --> 00:35:44,873
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me.
- I bet he does.

321
00:35:51,943 --> 00:35:55,103
You're going to wind up
working a school crosswalk.

322
00:35:55,783 --> 00:35:57,223
I'm cool.

323
00:35:57,303 --> 00:36:01,343
You didn't get that file from me, okay?
And don't tell me you owe me one.

324
00:36:02,543 --> 00:36:04,133
Ah, I owe you one!

325
00:36:04,383 --> 00:36:05,943
Yeah, right.

326
00:36:06,423 --> 00:36:07,703
Damn.

327
00:36:32,903 --> 00:36:36,373
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

328
00:36:36,623 --> 00:36:39,983
and watch this whole fucking city
burn from that window.

329
00:37:04,063 --> 00:37:06,663
There's a big fuckin' bird over there.

330
00:37:06,663 --> 00:37:08,543
Huh?

331
00:37:10,563 --> 00:37:12,283
It's a squab.

332
00:37:12,863 --> 00:37:14,583
Come here, bird.

333
00:37:15,463 --> 00:37:17,423
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

334
00:37:17,583 --> 00:37:19,343
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

335
00:37:19,823 --> 00:37:21,743
Here, birdie, birdie.

336
00:37:22,023 --> 00:37:24,503
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

337
00:37:27,383 --> 00:37:29,263
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

338
00:37:30,543 --> 00:37:32,143
Here, Funboy.

339
00:37:35,303 --> 00:37:36,943
What the fuck?

340
00:37:43,303 --> 00:37:47,063
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly
gave me a fucking heart attack!

341
00:37:47,703 --> 00:37:49,263
Look at him.

342
00:37:49,863 --> 00:37:51,983
Don't sweat it.

343
00:37:54,263 --> 00:37:57,543
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

344
00:38:05,303 --> 00:38:08,973
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

345
00:38:11,563 --> 00:38:16,513
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

346
00:38:16,763 --> 00:38:18,923
You need professional help.

347
00:38:22,183 --> 00:38:23,573
Bingo!

348
00:38:23,743 --> 00:38:25,663
He shoots!
He scores!

349
00:38:35,983 --> 00:38:40,073
- Jesus Christ!
- Jesus Christ?

350
00:38:40,323 --> 00:38:42,553
Stop me if you heard this one.

351
00:38:42,803 --> 00:38:45,203
Jesus Christ
walks into a hotel.

352
00:38:47,603 --> 00:38:48,803
Ow.

353
00:38:50,343 --> 00:38:53,313
He hands the innkeeper
three nails and he asks...

354
00:38:53,563 --> 00:38:56,423
Don't you ever fuckin' die?

355
00:38:56,543 --> 00:38:58,743
"Can you put me up for the night?"

356
00:39:03,943 --> 00:39:07,263
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it-- Fuck, does it hurt?

357
00:39:08,423 --> 00:39:10,023
Oh, God.

358
00:39:10,503 --> 00:39:14,323
Look what you've done to my sheets.

359
00:39:37,663 --> 00:39:39,903
I've got a gun in my pocket.

360
00:39:42,463 --> 00:39:44,983
You're happy to see me,
aren't you?

361
00:40:02,103 --> 00:40:05,133
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

362
00:40:13,343 --> 00:40:14,623
Look.

363
00:40:17,063 --> 00:40:20,823
Mother is the name for God
on the lips and hearts of all children.

364
00:40:21,423 --> 00:40:24,263
Do you understand?

365
00:40:23,703 --> 00:40:26,103
Morphine is bad for you.

366
00:40:37,183 --> 00:40:40,623
Your daughter is out there
on the streets waiting for you.

367
00:41:11,383 --> 00:41:13,063
If I wanted ice,
I would have asked for ice!

368
00:41:13,043 --> 00:41:14,723
Now fill it up!

369
00:41:16,883 --> 00:41:19,203
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

370
00:41:19,223 --> 00:41:21,063
I really need this.

371
00:41:28,503 --> 00:41:29,983
All right.

372
00:41:31,763 --> 00:41:34,143
You burn yourself
playing with matches?

373
00:41:34,103 --> 00:41:36,663
- Fuck off.
- You have an appointment.

374
00:41:36,463 --> 00:41:38,823
- Well, shit on me.
- Drink up.

375
00:41:38,943 --> 00:41:41,703
This is a first.
Do I bow or do I curtsy?

376
00:41:41,823 --> 00:41:44,383
Get my friend here a glass of blood.

377
00:41:45,143 --> 00:41:46,943
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

378
00:41:46,463 --> 00:41:49,213
Hey, good night, Darla.

379
00:41:53,023 --> 00:41:55,823
You stay put right there.

380
00:42:04,303 --> 00:42:06,983
Get away, steamhead.

381
00:42:26,103 --> 00:42:27,343
Shh.

382
00:42:37,503 --> 00:42:41,663
As you can see, I'm on the corner
of 27th and Washington...

383
00:42:43,103 --> 00:42:45,743
the site of last year's biggest
Devil's Night conflagration.

384
00:42:45,743 --> 00:42:48,703
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

385
00:42:48,703 --> 00:42:51,583
across the street from me
was totally demolished by fire.

386
00:42:51,583 --> 00:42:53,583
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

387
00:42:53,703 --> 00:42:55,863
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

388
00:42:55,863 --> 00:42:59,943
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police--

389
00:43:00,503 --> 00:43:01,863
Freeze!

390
00:43:03,383 --> 00:43:05,703
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

391
00:43:06,743 --> 00:43:08,623
Fuck.

392
00:43:11,243 --> 00:43:12,883
Good likeness.

393
00:43:12,743 --> 00:43:16,043
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

394
00:43:16,343 --> 00:43:18,953
You still have your hat on.

395
00:43:22,263 --> 00:43:24,023
I gotta sit down.

396
00:43:25,063 --> 00:43:26,343
Shi--

397
00:43:26,983 --> 00:43:28,983
Holy Shit.

398
00:43:31,103 --> 00:43:32,423
Say...

399
00:43:33,743 --> 00:43:37,693
are you some kind of... ghost?

400
00:43:37,943 --> 00:43:39,183
Boo!

401
00:43:47,063 --> 00:43:50,823
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

402
00:43:53,343 --> 00:43:56,343
You took a six-story swan dive
out of a window.

403
00:43:57,343 --> 00:44:00,093
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

404
00:44:00,343 --> 00:44:04,613
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

405
00:44:04,863 --> 00:44:06,863
Come on. Read the file.

406
00:44:07,463 --> 00:44:11,493
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

407
00:44:11,743 --> 00:44:14,143
Her body finally just gave it up.

408
00:44:14,863 --> 00:44:17,463
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

409
00:44:28,063 --> 00:44:29,983
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

410
00:44:33,183 --> 00:44:35,103
Hey.

411
00:44:36,443 --> 00:44:37,883
You okay?

412
00:44:37,943 --> 00:44:39,423
I saw her.

413
00:44:42,063 --> 00:44:44,303
I saw her through your eyes.

414
00:44:45,343 --> 00:44:47,383
You stayed with her the whole time.

415
00:44:47,383 --> 00:44:51,353
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

416
00:44:52,703 --> 00:44:56,683
I was hoping she'd come
out of it, you know.

417
00:44:57,303 --> 00:44:59,863
Give me something I could work with.

418
00:45:00,183 --> 00:45:01,463
Yeah.

419
00:45:03,383 --> 00:45:04,823
Look, I--

420
00:45:04,823 --> 00:45:07,263
Why didn't you do something about it?

421
00:45:07,263 --> 00:45:10,543
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

422
00:45:10,543 --> 00:45:13,183
would talk after what happened to you?

423
00:45:13,903 --> 00:45:16,223
I kept asking questions and...

424
00:45:17,063 --> 00:45:20,703
finally got busted for sticking
my nose where it wasn't wanted.

425
00:45:23,463 --> 00:45:25,143
This your wife?

426
00:45:25,423 --> 00:45:29,513
Yeah, we, uh-- Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

427
00:45:31,543 --> 00:45:33,063
It's funny.

428
00:45:34,423 --> 00:45:37,343
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

429
00:45:38,303 --> 00:45:41,103
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

430
00:45:41,343 --> 00:45:43,703
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

431
00:45:53,903 --> 00:45:56,983
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

432
00:46:03,163 --> 00:46:05,883
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

433
00:46:09,183 --> 00:46:11,663
I thought I'd use your front door.

434
00:46:14,743 --> 00:46:20,223
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what
happened to you and your girlfriend.

435
00:46:21,783 --> 00:46:23,063
Yeah.

436
00:46:28,343 --> 00:46:30,943
Yeah.

437
00:46:30,943 --> 00:46:34,143
I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

438
00:46:34,383 --> 00:46:37,183
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

439
00:46:37,503 --> 00:46:40,423
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

440
00:46:40,463 --> 00:46:43,223
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

441
00:46:43,663 --> 00:46:46,023
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

442
00:46:46,143 --> 00:46:50,343
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

443
00:46:50,423 --> 00:46:53,823
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

444
00:46:55,383 --> 00:46:57,823
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

445
00:46:57,823 --> 00:47:00,263
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

446
00:47:00,263 --> 00:47:04,193
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

447
00:47:05,663 --> 00:47:07,783
You ain't lost everything.

448
00:47:08,383 --> 00:47:12,643
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

449
00:47:13,343 --> 00:47:15,333
Fair enough.

450
00:47:15,583 --> 00:47:17,583
Catch.

451
00:47:17,823 --> 00:47:19,343
Aah! Jesus.

452
00:47:20,183 --> 00:47:22,623
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

453
00:47:22,623 --> 00:47:24,583
What're you tellin' me,
this thing is real?

454
00:47:24,583 --> 00:47:27,863
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

455
00:47:28,183 --> 00:47:31,703
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

456
00:47:32,023 --> 00:47:35,383
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

457
00:47:37,303 --> 00:47:38,583
Yeah.

458
00:47:38,703 --> 00:47:43,693
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

459
00:47:43,843 --> 00:47:47,043
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister?

460
00:47:46,943 --> 00:47:49,463
My father's daughter.
That's right.

461
00:47:50,223 --> 00:47:53,303
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

462
00:47:53,343 --> 00:47:55,583
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

463
00:47:55,583 --> 00:47:58,223
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

464
00:47:59,023 --> 00:48:02,143
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

465
00:48:02,423 --> 00:48:05,623
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

466
00:48:05,743 --> 00:48:07,983
Whatever the fuck that means.

467
00:48:08,323 --> 00:48:11,583
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

468
00:48:12,623 --> 00:48:14,743
Want to relax that thing now?

469
00:48:14,743 --> 00:48:17,983
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

470
00:48:19,263 --> 00:48:23,293
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

471
00:48:23,543 --> 00:48:25,703
I ain't makin' all this up.

472
00:48:26,183 --> 00:48:28,953
I ain't twisted like you two fucks.

473
00:48:32,183 --> 00:48:33,663
All right.

474
00:48:38,743 --> 00:48:42,963
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

475
00:48:43,583 --> 00:48:45,383
Yeah.

476
00:48:53,343 --> 00:48:56,463
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

477
00:49:02,903 --> 00:49:04,263
Thanks.

478
00:49:05,143 --> 00:49:07,463
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

479
00:49:07,463 --> 00:49:08,943
A big one.

480
00:49:10,023 --> 00:49:12,783
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

481
00:49:14,003 --> 00:49:17,093
I'll have the janitor come on up.

482
00:50:17,783 --> 00:50:19,263
You again.

483
00:50:20,023 --> 00:50:21,863
You lost or hungry?

484
00:50:22,343 --> 00:50:24,103
Hi.

485
00:50:27,263 --> 00:50:29,183
" It can't rain all the time "

486
00:50:29,183 --> 00:50:31,903
" Can't rain all the time "

487
00:50:42,223 --> 00:50:44,863
I don't know how many times
I gotta tell you. We're in this together!

488
00:50:44,863 --> 00:50:47,103
One part falls, it all falls!

489
00:50:47,743 --> 00:50:51,143
- You know how long it took us
to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

490
00:50:51,143 --> 00:50:53,663
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fuckin' voodoo doll!

491
00:50:53,663 --> 00:50:55,503
Tin Tin was a dick.

492
00:50:55,783 --> 00:50:57,543
Tin Tin.

493
00:50:58,703 --> 00:51:01,703
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

494
00:51:02,823 --> 00:51:04,343
Fire it up!

495
00:51:08,303 --> 00:51:09,983
No Funboy.

496
00:51:10,323 --> 00:51:13,643
Probably still...
bangin' away on Darla.

497
00:51:18,143 --> 00:51:20,543
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

498
00:51:21,883 --> 00:51:23,363
I'm on it.

499
00:51:53,863 --> 00:51:56,663
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

500
00:51:58,623 --> 00:52:01,103
I'm your passenger.

501
00:52:07,723 --> 00:52:09,043
Drive.

502
00:52:13,983 --> 00:52:15,783
What's all this happy horseshit?

503
00:52:16,083 --> 00:52:18,243
Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

504
00:52:23,063 --> 00:52:26,183
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

505
00:52:26,223 --> 00:52:29,833
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

506
00:52:36,743 --> 00:52:41,653
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

507
00:52:42,543 --> 00:52:45,023
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

508
00:52:45,423 --> 00:52:48,543
- This is business, right?
- Faster.

509
00:52:51,183 --> 00:52:53,263
You got that cream stuff?

510
00:52:55,263 --> 00:52:58,423
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

511
00:52:59,103 --> 00:53:02,023
What in the crap--

512
00:53:05,303 --> 00:53:07,893
Oh, look. Makin' us popular.

513
00:53:08,143 --> 00:53:10,783
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

514
00:53:16,023 --> 00:53:19,303
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

515
00:53:21,343 --> 00:53:22,623
Turn.

516
00:53:24,663 --> 00:53:27,383
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

517
00:53:27,383 --> 00:53:29,993
Right? Huh?

518
00:53:33,103 --> 00:53:35,613
Damn! Dead end!

519
00:53:40,663 --> 00:53:43,343
Look out!

520
00:53:46,183 --> 00:53:48,503
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

521
00:54:00,243 --> 00:54:03,603
Holy shit!
Goddamn foreign cars!

522
00:54:07,883 --> 00:54:09,403
Shit! Shit!

523
00:54:17,783 --> 00:54:20,223
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

524
00:54:20,703 --> 00:54:23,743
T-bird!
I got you, man!

525
00:54:24,063 --> 00:54:26,103
Shit!

526
00:54:39,223 --> 00:54:41,463
Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

527
00:54:41,463 --> 00:54:44,183
But I don't know what--
What? Huh? What?

528
00:54:44,923 --> 00:54:47,193
What are you talkin' about?
No, no, no, no, no.

529
00:54:47,443 --> 00:54:50,483
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

530
00:54:50,383 --> 00:54:52,293
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

531
00:54:52,543 --> 00:54:55,493
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

532
00:54:55,743 --> 00:54:59,013
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

533
00:54:59,263 --> 00:55:02,413
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

534
00:55:02,663 --> 00:55:05,613
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

535
00:55:05,863 --> 00:55:09,913
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

536
00:55:12,063 --> 00:55:14,503
Did you send us these complaints?

537
00:55:15,503 --> 00:55:18,493
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

538
00:55:18,743 --> 00:55:20,743
Does it get you sweaty?

539
00:55:21,103 --> 00:55:23,103
I know you. I know you.

540
00:55:24,423 --> 00:55:25,893
I knew I knew you.

541
00:55:26,143 --> 00:55:29,933
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

542
00:55:30,183 --> 00:55:34,103
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

543
00:55:34,103 --> 00:55:37,423
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

544
00:55:37,423 --> 00:55:39,743
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

545
00:55:39,743 --> 00:55:42,143
T-bird--

546
00:55:44,143 --> 00:55:47,463
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

547
00:55:49,463 --> 00:55:51,783
T-bird.

548
00:55:53,543 --> 00:55:56,583
"Abashed the devil stood...

549
00:55:56,783 --> 00:55:59,183
and felt how awful goodness is."

550
00:55:59,663 --> 00:56:02,593
"And felt how awful goodness is."

551
00:56:15,943 --> 00:56:18,143
T-bird. T-bird.

552
00:57:06,703 --> 00:57:09,023
This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

553
00:57:09,023 --> 00:57:11,343
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

554
00:57:11,343 --> 00:57:15,583
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

555
00:57:15,583 --> 00:57:18,903
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

556
00:57:18,903 --> 00:57:22,903
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

557
00:57:24,103 --> 00:57:28,683
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

558
00:57:29,183 --> 00:57:32,623
The mayor has firefighters
from all surrounding counties--

559
00:57:32,743 --> 00:57:36,743
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

560
00:57:38,343 --> 00:57:40,983
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

561
00:57:41,583 --> 00:57:43,133
Wait, you loved eggs.

562
00:57:43,383 --> 00:57:45,533
Yeah, when I was five.

563
00:57:45,783 --> 00:57:49,023
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

564
00:57:49,863 --> 00:57:52,983
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

565
00:57:53,163 --> 00:57:58,273
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

566
00:57:58,523 --> 00:57:59,843
Who?

567
00:58:00,773 --> 00:58:02,973
Oh, it was nuts.

568
00:58:03,923 --> 00:58:08,393
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

569
00:58:11,463 --> 00:58:15,463
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

570
00:58:16,063 --> 00:58:17,543
Over easy.

571
00:58:19,383 --> 00:58:23,373
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

572
00:58:34,663 --> 00:58:36,303
Hey, Albrecht.

573
00:58:38,863 --> 00:58:41,743
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

574
00:58:41,743 --> 00:58:44,903
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

575
00:58:44,903 --> 00:58:48,773
- We're gonna have to I.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

576
00:58:49,023 --> 00:58:50,943
Arson was his specialty.

577
00:58:50,943 --> 00:58:52,903
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

578
00:58:52,903 --> 00:58:56,323
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'-shit.

579
00:58:56,743 --> 00:58:58,223
Come here.

580
00:59:02,503 --> 00:59:04,503
You're holding out on me.

581
00:59:04,503 --> 00:59:07,943
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

582
00:59:07,943 --> 00:59:10,503
and you're covering up for somebody.

583
00:59:11,143 --> 00:59:13,583
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

584
00:59:13,583 --> 00:59:17,113
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

585
00:59:17,383 --> 00:59:19,463
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

586
00:59:19,463 --> 00:59:22,343
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

587
00:59:22,343 --> 00:59:25,223
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

588
00:59:25,223 --> 00:59:27,143
and you're saying this is just
a fuckin' automobile accident?

589
00:59:27,143 --> 00:59:29,383
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

590
00:59:29,383 --> 00:59:31,423
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

591
00:59:31,423 --> 00:59:33,423
You gotta write that shit down.

592
00:59:33,423 --> 00:59:35,343
All right, smart-ass.

593
00:59:35,343 --> 00:59:38,303
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

594
00:59:38,303 --> 00:59:42,143
- Welcome to the first day of the
rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

595
00:59:42,143 --> 00:59:45,513
- For what?
- Misconduct.

596
00:59:47,823 --> 00:59:50,463
Yeah, give me the lab.

597
01:00:38,343 --> 01:00:40,903
One for sorrow,
two for joy...

598
01:00:40,903 --> 01:00:44,063
- Come here.
- ...three for a girl, four for a boy.

599
01:00:48,463 --> 01:00:49,903
Dancing--

600
01:01:22,643 --> 01:01:23,923
Eric?

601
01:01:26,983 --> 01:01:29,743
Man, Sarah, you're going crazy.

602
01:01:30,983 --> 01:01:32,983
Gabriel.

603
01:01:33,963 --> 01:01:35,933
I thought you were dead.

604
01:01:36,683 --> 01:01:38,683
You're not dead, are you?

605
01:02:03,763 --> 01:02:06,363
I knew it was you.

606
01:02:08,363 --> 01:02:10,613
Even with the makeup.

607
01:02:15,743 --> 01:02:17,743
I remembered your song.

608
01:02:18,343 --> 01:02:20,343
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

609
01:02:21,943 --> 01:02:23,943
That is from your song, right?

610
01:02:34,663 --> 01:02:37,663
Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

611
01:02:39,903 --> 01:02:42,453
I miss you...
and Shelly.

612
01:02:46,783 --> 01:02:49,033
Get so lonely all by myself.

613
01:02:51,863 --> 01:02:55,913
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

614
01:02:56,883 --> 01:02:59,933
Sarah, I do care.

615
01:03:10,103 --> 01:03:12,103
That's him!
That's him!

616
01:03:12,263 --> 01:03:15,293
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

617
01:03:15,543 --> 01:03:18,493
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

618
01:03:18,743 --> 01:03:20,973
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

619
01:03:21,223 --> 01:03:23,733
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fuckin' car!

620
01:03:23,983 --> 01:03:26,733
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

621
01:03:27,423 --> 01:03:31,273
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

622
01:03:32,463 --> 01:03:36,733
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

623
01:03:36,983 --> 01:03:39,083
- Empty.
- Fire it--

624
01:03:39,543 --> 01:03:41,213
Grave?
What grave?

625
01:03:41,463 --> 01:03:43,463
What about my fuckin' grave?

626
01:03:43,663 --> 01:03:44,663
Three out of four.

627
01:03:44,943 --> 01:03:47,943
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

628
01:03:48,183 --> 01:03:50,573
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

629
01:03:50,823 --> 01:03:53,693
That boy was out of control.
T-bird, he came in, he says...

630
01:03:53,943 --> 01:03:57,643
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

631
01:04:00,983 --> 01:04:03,533
This ghost gonna kill my ass next.

632
01:04:03,983 --> 01:04:05,983
- This ghost gonna kill--
- Hey.

633
01:04:07,703 --> 01:04:08,703
That ain't no ghost.

634
01:04:11,383 --> 01:04:13,983
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

635
01:04:14,363 --> 01:04:15,913
We might need him.

636
01:04:17,863 --> 01:04:18,863
Ghost gonna kill my--

637
01:04:32,383 --> 01:04:34,383
He like his plain or with onions?

638
01:04:36,223 --> 01:04:38,473
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

639
01:04:39,623 --> 01:04:42,623
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

640
01:04:43,623 --> 01:04:45,173
That's what I thought.

641
01:04:46,143 --> 01:04:48,613
Are you referring to anyone
in particular?

642
01:04:48,863 --> 01:04:50,863
You'll just think I'm nuts.

643
01:04:51,143 --> 01:04:54,143
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

644
01:04:54,623 --> 01:04:59,573
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

645
01:05:00,123 --> 01:05:02,273
Maybe it was your fairy godfather.

646
01:05:03,563 --> 01:05:05,893
Eric didn't come back for me.

647
01:05:06,143 --> 01:05:09,143
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

648
01:05:10,783 --> 01:05:13,483
You want a friend to walk you home?

649
01:06:44,103 --> 01:06:45,103
Boys.

650
01:06:46,983 --> 01:06:49,983
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

651
01:06:50,383 --> 01:06:52,383
on account of a slight case of death.

652
01:06:53,023 --> 01:06:54,133
You wanna sit down?

653
01:06:57,683 --> 01:06:59,333
Well, well, well.

654
01:06:59,583 --> 01:07:01,583
Devil's Night is upon us again.

655
01:07:02,583 --> 01:07:04,253
I thought we'd throw a little party...

656
01:07:04,503 --> 01:07:06,903
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

657
01:07:07,703 --> 01:07:09,703
I like the pretty lights.

658
01:07:11,943 --> 01:07:15,893
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

659
01:07:16,583 --> 01:07:21,373
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

660
01:07:21,623 --> 01:07:23,773
Only reason to quit.

661
01:07:24,583 --> 01:07:27,333
A man has an idea.

662
01:07:29,343 --> 01:07:31,293
The idea attracts others...

663
01:07:31,543 --> 01:07:32,543
like-minded.

664
01:07:33,623 --> 01:07:35,493
The idea expands.

665
01:07:35,743 --> 01:07:38,993
The idea becomes an institution.

666
01:07:40,243 --> 01:07:41,693
What was the idea?

667
01:07:42,943 --> 01:07:44,943
See, that's what's been
bothering me, boys.

668
01:07:45,623 --> 01:07:48,133
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

669
01:07:48,383 --> 01:07:50,683
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

670
01:07:52,123 --> 01:07:53,123
You see, gentlemen...

671
01:07:53,623 --> 01:07:57,073
greed is for amateurs.

672
01:07:58,423 --> 01:08:02,473
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

673
01:08:03,503 --> 01:08:05,153
now that's fun!

674
01:08:04,903 --> 01:08:06,903
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

675
01:08:08,303 --> 01:08:11,303
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

676
01:08:11,703 --> 01:08:14,703
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

677
01:08:14,743 --> 01:08:16,743
Do you know what they got now?

678
01:08:18,063 --> 01:08:20,713
Devil's Night greeting cards.

679
01:08:22,263 --> 01:08:23,713
Isn't that precious?

680
01:08:25,143 --> 01:08:26,423
Yeah.

681
01:08:27,223 --> 01:08:30,773
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

682
01:08:31,863 --> 01:08:33,863
Time to move along.

683
01:08:33,823 --> 01:08:36,013
You don't want us to do "Light My Fire"
time for the whole city?

684
01:08:36,263 --> 01:08:37,263
No.

685
01:08:38,743 --> 01:08:41,053
No, I want you to set a fire
so goddamn big...

686
01:08:41,303 --> 01:08:44,303
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

687
01:08:44,343 --> 01:08:46,613
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

688
01:08:46,863 --> 01:08:50,973
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

689
01:08:51,223 --> 01:08:53,223
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

690
01:08:53,263 --> 01:08:54,933
Skank!
You don't feel that?

691
01:08:55,183 --> 01:08:58,183
I feel like a little worm
on a big fuckin' hook.

692
01:08:58,383 --> 01:09:00,573
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fuckin' hook."

693
01:09:00,823 --> 01:09:03,823
Well, boy, your mama must be
damn proud of you!

694
01:09:07,383 --> 01:09:09,383
How the hell did that thing
get in here?

695
01:09:11,223 --> 01:09:13,223
Gentlemen.

696
01:09:13,703 --> 01:09:16,703
Let me go! Let me go!
I gotta go!

697
01:09:22,503 --> 01:09:25,933
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

698
01:09:26,183 --> 01:09:28,183
The killer of killers.

699
01:09:28,663 --> 01:09:30,663
Nice outfit.

700
01:09:31,503 --> 01:09:33,503
I'm not sure about the face though.

701
01:09:33,503 --> 01:09:35,293
I just want him.

702
01:09:35,943 --> 01:09:37,943
Well, you can't have him.

703
01:09:38,943 --> 01:09:39,943
Well...

704
01:09:43,463 --> 01:09:45,463
I see you have made your decision.

705
01:09:47,303 --> 01:09:49,303
Now let's see you enforce it.

706
01:09:49,343 --> 01:09:52,343
Aw, this is already boring
the shit out of me. Kill him!

707
01:09:58,463 --> 01:10:00,713
Ooh, that had to hurt.

708
01:10:03,903 --> 01:10:05,903
Well, that's that.

709
01:10:05,103 --> 01:10:07,103
That guy was crazy.

710
01:10:14,463 --> 01:10:15,463
He's gone.

711
01:10:23,943 --> 01:10:24,943
Get him!

712
01:10:42,143 --> 01:10:45,043
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

713
01:10:49,663 --> 01:10:51,213
Jesus Christ!

714
01:11:06,343 --> 01:11:07,583
Hey!

715
01:11:39,783 --> 01:11:41,783
You're all going to die.

716
01:11:56,063 --> 01:11:58,063
Get the fuck outta here!

717
01:12:33,103 --> 01:12:35,733
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

718
01:12:35,983 --> 01:12:38,893
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

719
01:12:39,143 --> 01:12:42,653
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

720
01:12:43,103 --> 01:12:44,103
No!

721
01:12:51,063 --> 01:12:53,063
What in the crap--

722
01:12:53,863 --> 01:12:55,863
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

723
01:12:56,463 --> 01:12:58,463
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

724
01:13:08,503 --> 01:13:11,503
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

725
01:13:14,543 --> 01:13:17,193
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

726
01:13:18,103 --> 01:13:19,103
...arms and legs--

727
01:13:25,503 --> 01:13:28,753
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs--

728
01:14:11,023 --> 01:14:13,023
Come on! Move it!

729
01:14:17,703 --> 01:14:20,503
My advice:
Next time duck.

730
01:14:22,703 --> 01:14:24,703
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

731
01:14:28,263 --> 01:14:30,263
Shit!

732
01:14:34,023 --> 01:14:36,913
Oh. I knew you were gonna do that.

733
01:14:37,763 --> 01:14:38,913
Look at that out there.

734
01:14:39,163 --> 01:14:41,963
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

735
01:14:42,923 --> 01:14:44,693
Sky oughta be red.

736
01:14:45,343 --> 01:14:49,093
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

737
01:14:49,583 --> 01:14:54,033
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

738
01:14:55,103 --> 01:14:57,733
- I like him already.
- The crow...

739
01:14:57,983 --> 01:15:01,183
is his link between
the land of the living...

740
01:15:01,483 --> 01:15:04,133
and the realm of the dead.

741
01:15:04,703 --> 01:15:08,503
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

742
01:15:09,103 --> 01:15:10,343
Hmm.

743
01:15:33,343 --> 01:15:35,343
I'm coming home, Shelly.

744
01:16:22,183 --> 01:16:24,293
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

745
01:16:24,543 --> 01:16:26,543
in the middle of the night, right?

746
01:16:26,583 --> 01:16:28,133
Safest place in the world to be.

747
01:16:28,383 --> 01:16:32,733
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

748
01:16:34,123 --> 01:16:36,473
It's really late, Sarah.

749
01:16:36,663 --> 01:16:38,663
You didn't say good-bye.

750
01:16:39,863 --> 01:16:41,913
You're just gonna have to forgive
me for that.

751
01:16:43,743 --> 01:16:45,893
And you're never coming back.

752
01:16:53,863 --> 01:16:56,063
I gave this to Shelly once.

753
01:17:00,503 --> 01:17:03,153
I think she'd like you to have it.

754
01:17:07,223 --> 01:17:09,223
This way you'll always
remember her.

755
01:17:09,503 --> 01:17:11,503
I'll never take it off.

756
01:17:29,683 --> 01:17:32,083
I better go sneak back
in the house.

757
01:17:39,663 --> 01:17:40,663
Bye.

758
01:17:59,903 --> 01:18:01,903
Shh! Shh!

759
01:18:04,503 --> 01:18:06,503
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

760
01:18:13,463 --> 01:18:14,913
Come on.
Come on.

761
01:18:28,543 --> 01:18:32,593
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

762
01:18:34,023 --> 01:18:37,023
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

763
01:18:43,223 --> 01:18:45,973
Her eyes are so innocent.

764
01:18:57,223 --> 01:18:58,223
Eric!

765
01:18:59,143 --> 01:19:00,693
Eric, help! Eric!

766
01:19:41,083 --> 01:19:43,083
Quick impression for ya.

767
01:19:43,943 --> 01:19:46,543
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

768
01:19:47,583 --> 01:19:50,583
Give me the girl and I'll let you
walk out of here.

769
01:19:52,523 --> 01:19:54,023
Well, well.

770
01:19:53,863 --> 01:19:56,863
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

771
01:20:06,403 --> 01:20:07,603
Nah. Fuck it.

772
01:20:16,383 --> 01:20:17,533
Aw, fuck.

773
01:20:24,423 --> 01:20:28,573
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

774
01:20:28,823 --> 01:20:32,273
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

775
01:20:37,263 --> 01:20:40,013
Well, for a ghost, you bleed just fine.

776
01:20:43,343 --> 01:20:45,343
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

777
01:20:47,363 --> 01:20:49,113
Bye-bye, birdie.

778
01:21:32,463 --> 01:21:34,113
Ah, shit.

779
01:21:34,543 --> 01:21:36,543
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

780
01:21:36,583 --> 01:21:38,583
and here you are getting
all shot up again.

781
01:21:38,623 --> 01:21:40,623
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

782
01:21:41,223 --> 01:21:42,223
Two more.

783
01:21:43,183 --> 01:21:45,183
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

784
01:21:45,183 --> 01:21:47,183
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

785
01:21:47,663 --> 01:21:50,093
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

786
01:21:50,343 --> 01:21:53,943
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

787
01:21:56,463 --> 01:21:59,013
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

788
01:21:59,903 --> 01:22:01,903
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

789
01:22:01,983 --> 01:22:04,833
I was.
I'm not anymore.

790
01:22:05,983 --> 01:22:08,983
Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

791
01:22:09,203 --> 01:22:10,203
Come on.

792
01:22:14,863 --> 01:22:15,863
You take that.

793
01:22:45,703 --> 01:22:48,703
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

794
01:23:12,063 --> 01:23:14,763
This is all the power you ever had.

795
01:23:15,303 --> 01:23:17,003
Now it is mine.

796
01:23:17,783 --> 01:23:19,783
Pity there's not more time...

797
01:23:20,983 --> 01:23:22,983
...for us.

798
01:23:40,863 --> 01:23:42,863
Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

799
01:23:46,063 --> 01:23:47,063
Let me go!

800
01:23:57,383 --> 01:23:58,383
Let her go!

801
01:24:01,223 --> 01:24:04,273
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

802
01:24:05,803 --> 01:24:06,803
All right.

803
01:24:06,743 --> 01:24:08,743
No!

804
01:24:53,183 --> 01:24:54,463
Eric!

805
01:25:12,783 --> 01:25:15,383
- Sarah?
- Look out!

806
01:25:21,063 --> 01:25:22,063
Eric!

807
01:25:30,063 --> 01:25:31,973
You know, my daddy used to say...

808
01:25:32,223 --> 01:25:34,223
"Every man's got a devil...

809
01:25:34,703 --> 01:25:36,703
and you can't rest till you find him."

810
01:25:36,903 --> 01:25:38,903
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend--

811
01:25:39,343 --> 01:25:41,343
I cleared that building.

812
01:25:42,223 --> 01:25:45,173
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

813
01:25:45,423 --> 01:25:47,873
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

814
01:25:48,263 --> 01:25:50,713
But if it's any consolation to you...

815
01:25:51,023 --> 01:25:54,073
you have put a smile on my face.

816
01:25:54,583 --> 01:25:56,583
You got a lot of spirit, son.

817
01:25:57,583 --> 01:25:59,583
I am going to miss you.

818
01:25:59,783 --> 01:26:01,783
I have something to give you.

819
01:26:02,263 --> 01:26:04,263
I don't want it anymore.

820
01:26:08,863 --> 01:26:09,863
Thirty hours of pain!

821
01:26:14,023 --> 01:26:16,023
All at once!

822
01:26:17,763 --> 01:26:19,763
All for you.

823
01:26:44,103 --> 01:26:45,383
Yeah.

824
01:26:53,703 --> 01:26:54,703
Go help him.

825
01:26:59,983 --> 01:27:01,233
Are you alive?

826
01:27:04,603 --> 01:27:07,303
God, I need a cigarette.

827
01:27:13,303 --> 01:27:14,403
Everybody else dead?

828
01:27:15,223 --> 01:27:16,673
You helped me.

829
01:27:17,463 --> 01:27:19,663
What you kept in here saved me.

830
01:27:20,023 --> 01:27:22,373
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

831
01:27:23,063 --> 01:27:25,063
I've been meaning to come
to church anyway.

832
01:27:30,743 --> 01:27:31,743
Oh, yuck.

833
01:27:34,163 --> 01:27:37,263
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

834
01:27:47,083 --> 01:27:49,533
Stay with him until help comes.

835
01:27:49,983 --> 01:27:52,533
He'll be okay, right?

836
01:27:53,183 --> 01:27:54,463
Eric?

837
01:27:57,263 --> 01:27:59,263
He does that a lot.

838
01:28:15,743 --> 01:28:17,103
Shelly.

839
01:28:30,223 --> 01:28:34,253
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

840
01:28:34,503 --> 01:28:36,503
At least it stopped raining, huh?

841
01:28:37,143 --> 01:28:40,213
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

842
01:28:40,463 --> 01:28:43,493
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

843
01:28:43,743 --> 01:28:45,193
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

844
01:28:45,663 --> 01:28:48,663
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

845
01:28:50,143 --> 01:28:51,543
You missed it.

846
01:28:52,483 --> 01:28:53,783
Get him outta here!

847
01:29:56,263 --> 01:29:57,263
Thanks.

848
01:30:03,143 --> 01:30:06,093
If the people we love
are stolen from us...

849
01:30:06,343 --> 01:30:11,053
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

850
01:30:11,103 --> 01:30:15,853
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.

851
01:30:18,803 --> 01:30:22,853
Subresync by Chros69
